message.content:
cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.HC, cs.CY, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses measuring the impact and success of a co-creative, cooperative agent in a game-like interactive system. This involves concepts such as computational intelligence, mixed-initiative systems, and computational co-creativity, which are all relevant to the field of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the use of electronic and tabletop games, which falls under the category of graphics (cs.GR). Additionally, the paper discusses the importance of user experience and interaction design, which falls under human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The paper also touches on the topic of cybersecurity, as it proposes scenarios for future research that involve cooperative agents in potentially sensitive environments (cs.CY). Finally, the paper proposes metrics for evaluating the performance of cooperative agents, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG).
